title: Important Export Improvements Needed
text:
When exporting data from any device the App should first of all generate the PDF or CSV or spreadsheet data, and then after that allow the user to send that output to email or any other app of their choosing. As it is, the only thing I can do when creating data for export is use the Apple email program directly. 

Many of us do not use built-in apple mail and we may want to simply export a PDF and take that into the doctor. Also, I want to be able to examine the export the data, especially if it's a PDF, before I do anything with it.  The point being that, we need to have flexibility when exporting. The iGlucose App handles exporting perfectly. The iHealth App simply needs to follow suit. Thanks so much for seeing to this at your earliest possible convenience.

title: So you need to know my birthday and where I live to use your product? Nope.
text:
Guys, I bought your blood pressure monitor a couple years back, and really liked how it connected to the app on my phone. So now when I decided to start monitoring my weight for my new fitness routine, you were the first company I thought of to purchase a scale from. But then I download your app, and it says I have to create an account with my email address (red flag #1). Then it says I have to download the new “pro” app, which according to the apple app store collects and stores my data on the cloud (red flag #2). So I go to your website (without downloading the new app) and find where I can create an account online, which prompts me to enter my name, date of birth, location, weight, height… 

I “nope” out of that and go back to the original app (which according to the apple App Store you claim does NOT collect my information on the cloud and it now allows me to login to the app, and promptly requests that I enter my height and weight. Which then shows up in my online cloud account… sorry guys, but nope. You don’t need to know this information about me, and I don’t know you. Even if I did trust you not to sell my data to advertisers ( and who has time to read your privacy policy anyway) I certainly don’t trust that you won’t get hacked and my data will be out there anyway.

title: WHY wont you FIX this dang app!??
text: I love the convenience of the bluetooth cuff aside from the times when it wont actually connect to the app which is numerous. You would think after spending over $100 on the bp cuff that these app decs would FIX the friken app so it would actually connect. I have been on these people for four years now to fix their connection issues. Crickets. It is astonishing they simply seem not to care about this junk app which is incredible. They spend millions of dollars on ihealth bp/health hardware yet they dont care that the app is useless which makes all the hardware useless as well. I wish a more competent company would creat a bluetooth bp cuff with an app that actually worked. The only reason these people havent went bankrupt yet is because they have no competition. This is like buying a fancy new car yet you cant drive it because the software won't allow you to actually start the car. Their non chalance & ineptitude is absolutely incredible when you think about it. Wow.

title: No hardware problem, Diary could stand improving
text:
I have been using MyVitals with the BPL3 for several years. I got a new phone with the lightning connector and had to get the Ease. I have now added the Core scale and the Wave watch. Absolutely no hardware issues. Everything works
The reasons I am withholding the last star is improvements I need for the app. One, it will only allow two blood pressure readings a day. Not acceptable.
Two, while the integration of the “diary” to the calories and activity is smooth, it is not user friendly.
First of all, is finding this feature, which by its nature will be the most accessed, is difficult. It is buried deep in the app under settings.
Next, food entries are exclusively in ounces, while every nutrition guide I have found so far is in grams.
While they include a food list rivals Nutritionix, it will have everything but what you eat. Entry of new items often means deconstructing an item to its basic parts, translating grams to ounces and adding sub parts to the database as well. But there is no was to go back and edit you entry. Also it would be easier to make those entries on a large screen like a PC rather than an iPhone screen, but there is no Windows program or app.

title: Once you weigh you cannot look at your stats
text: Here is my 2 cents.  Once I weigh myself I’m able to make a note,  great   But, there is no menu bar or way to transition from my current weight that I just measured to my history or to a graph/chart or even just a home button. So once I weigh and make a note, I have to close the app, then I have to  swipe to completely close the app so I can then go back and open the app to the home page and I can check my history or look and the graphs.  It would make sense to have a “save” button that takes you back to your weight history so you would see your trending.  Help.

title: App support
text: I like all the details it brings with all the reading because I have all the gadgets pulse Oximeter, scale and blood pressure. When is the app going to support better the Apple Watch or Apple health environment to include MyFitnessPal? Apart from those question IHealth is an awesome health tracker but it needs the merge of information for those platform. It says coming soon but is been like that for a bunch of months and another one apart from the BMI it should include body measurements it will make it perfect. Apple Watch support and MyFitnessPal. Most other health apps got ahead like Nokia or withings but at least this app has more details

title: So far, some easily fixable annoyances
text:
I got to the third screen of creating an account, then left the app to go generate a password in my password manager. When I returned, it took me back ot the home screen and I had to enter it all again!

I did my first reading, it was a bit high, so I spent a few minutes relaxing, only for it to tell me I already did a reading today, come back tomorrow! It's my device, let me do what I want! Especially when it's new, and requires proper placement, and proper positioning for accurate results, saying you can't do it again, is absurd.

title: Great App
text: So far I have not had any of the problems that anyone else has had with the app or any other iHealth hardware monitoring. I use 1byone Bluetooth scale, iHealth Ease and Sugar Sense. They all interface nicely sharing data between each other seven they're all in one location so that when I see my doctor everything is right there. It wasn't as hard as others made out to start using the blood pressure monitor the instructions were really simple that came with it you just need to download the one functionality which is the iHeath vitals.

title: app unable to connect pulse oximeter
text: my oximeter from ihealth arrived today, paid $80 (including tax and shipping) for something i can get for $10, i was confused as i thought it will connect like all other bluetooth devices, but it didnt, you have to open the "connect devices" menu and add the device from there, once connected it works nicely, i have become a fan of bluetooth LE, ihealth if you are listening all your devices should use bluetooth LE its awesome.

title: UPDATE,  Does not work as advertised with pulse oximeter
text:
I want to set the record straight.  I did finally figure out how to get the stored data on the pulse ox to work.  It is not obvious.  After connecting via ere is a small text in the lower left corner in a subdued color that says “filter data”.  Selecting that brings up a screen that allows uploads. 

I really like the product and that app is pretty good.  I will give it 4 stars due to poor documentation.  Help for this was neither on the website or the included manual.   Note to developers.  Include in docs section called “uploading stored data”.

title: Please update and fix
text: Thank you for the most recent update to the dark mode UI. That was quick and we appreciate it. There’s a typo or at least not proper English in the “set up my device.” If the device is not connected you have the option to forget it although instead it state “forgot it.” Please adjust . I saw another review here that talked about the app crashing when you first initially log in. I had the same issue initially. Please advise, thanks

title: Aggravating app
text: Using with the iHealth "Ease" blood pressure device.  Unit appears to work OK, and has fair documentation manuals. However, the app has virtually no documentation and requires considerable trial and error to understand. Difficult to set up multiple profiles for different people to track their BP numbers.  I have been able to use the "triple check" feature on only one profile.  The app gives the "you've already been tested - wait until tomorrow" warning when attempting to "triple test" another setup profile.  At this time, I would not recommend the app or the "Ease" blood pressure monitor since the "Ease" only works with the iHealth app.

title: Love but don't like the sleep stages
text: I love that iHealth Wave automatically tracks my steps and exercise activity and even the total miles walked, along with approximate calories burned.  I'd recommend this to anyone who wants to pay attention to their health. I don't care for the sleep stages though that shows you deep sleep times and light sleep times. It's hard to read.  I love the slim width design and all the wrist band options. It would be great if the height from the wrist was a little slimmer.  Also I hope the app supports iphone7plus as soon as possible.

title: Could be a Great App if...
text: Been using this app on and off for over four years to monitor my blood pressure and weight using their hardware  (cuff and scale) and has worked with no problems. Only downside is I have to use a separate iHealth app (iGluco) for my BG and a separate one for sleeping…wish iHealth could connect with my iPhone/Watch ‘Sleep Watch’ app. That way I could have all my health information in one place to share with my doctors (kidney transplant patient). Overall I’m happy with this app.

title: Categories
text:
This app needs to have the following inputs.... Blood Pressure, pulse Ox, glucose, temperature, weight and heart rate! Disappointing they don’t!

RE: response
Why would I have to use an add’l app when everything could be within the one app. If I use this to show my doctor my vitals I have to open two apps instead of one!! This is why I quit using I health. Just develop an app that includes ALL categories of vitals! I don’t want to have to utilize two or three apps to keep track of my vitals. Thank you for your response but I guess IHealth isn’t for me I will track my vitals manually on paper. I only have to show one form that way at my doctor visit.

title: Beautiful and intuitive, but...
text: I love the app, it's easy to use, extremely well designed, and the goal make it immersive and fun. I only wish there was more feedback on our accumulated data. I would love to be prompted with information regarding progress or lack thereof, as well as possible correlations. Sometimes I have trouble getting excited about all the wonderful information I'm collecting.

title: Works fine but limited functionality
text:
I connected fine and have been using the scale and app for about 2 months now. I just wish the app would give better graphs. For example would be great to see 2,3,4 month ranges. 1 month is too short to really see my progress and 1 year is much too long. Would also be nice to see overlays like BMI or Body fat %. 

I am only using the scale for now but conserving adding the blood pressure device

title: Buggy products with terrible support
text:
I was really excited when my wife surprised me with this. A buddy and I had been talking about exactly this type of product the night before - seemed meant to be! (We have the Core). 

Unfortunately this product does not work properly from wild variances in how it estimates % body fat to refusing to sync despite being reconnected over and over again. To top it off, customer service and support is HORRENDOUS and NONEXISTENT! 

I hope Apple sues this company and they go bankrupt because I’m sure my wife was hypnotized buy the small i before Health. I for one will leave the feedback with the better business bureau.

title: Worked great for 2 weeks....
text: Ok so the cuff worked great with my iphone for 2 week. I took my BP in the morning and again in the evening. Each time with the triple check. For the past couple of days i cannot do the triple check as i am keep getting a message that i have checked too many times today and try again tomorrow. For the manufacturers.... i bought this cuff. Its my iphone i want to know why i cannottake my Bp as often as i want!

title: Using app with Wave
text: So far the app has been pretty straight forward.. this is only my second day ever using a iHealth, and I do really enjoy it. I mainly bought a Wave to track my sleep and workouts so other functions are just extra for me. It's pretty cool  if the app has the challenges and workout videos  in the future. I feel being able to interact with other people in the iHealth community could be very helpful and motivating.

title: Like but dislike
text: iHealth try’s to keep track of a lot data. Apple Product users (iPhone & Apple Watch) are at a disadvantage.  The software does not take advantage of Apple  Health is which means data has to be entered manually if the devIces are not on there approved list. The data entry for the software is only comparable with a few selected devices. Apple Health is compatible with a lot more devices which both load to and download from Apple Health.

title: Love it
text: I love there dedication and support they fulfill to their customers (also me). They listen to you and add things/fix things when you tell them. The app is complex, but extremely easy to use. It's compatible with Apple health, so my data syncs seamlessly with Apple health. Fitbit doesn't even let you sync your data with external sources, probably so they can take more of our money.

title: Not All Accessable
text: Overall I like the security and tracking capabilities of the app, however, it only connects by Bluetooth to the developer’s own equipment and not other Bluetooth devices.  In most cases it has a “manual input” capability for most of the vital signs trackers.  The sleep and exercise does not have a manual input so I can’t track my sleep from my APAP machine nor can I track my steps or exercise.  The app does not include any method of tracking blood glucose so I cannot track my glucose tear readings at all.  So in this respect I can only give it 2 stars.

title: Don't Buy
text: Couldn't connect to my wifi network because the device kept timing out. Tech support sent out another scale had the same problem. Following the troubleshooting guide doesn't work and tech support was limited. No other problems with using my wireless devices connecting to my home network!

title: Bad customer support. Bugs in the app
text: The app worked for a while and then it started showing the wrong time and date. It switched to a different time zone somehow. Emailed customer support twice. After the first initial email nobody contacted me and there is no way to find any how-to information in the internet. Very upsetting. It also crashes when you click on certain buttons within the app. It needs to be updated...

title: No App Support
text: Sent them an email about a problem about 2 months ago and still have not received a response.  The program is very basic and buggy.  Will not turn and requires you to change orientation of you devise.  Can not export blood pressure traces.  Some of the problems discussed two years ago have not been fixed.  Suggest you look for an alternative if you have not yet purchased the product.

title: app cannot find the scale
text: I bought the H5S some years ago. In the beginning, it would work intermittently. As of the latest iOS and app version, the app cannot find the scale. The troubleshoot as described in the app is useless. It prompts the user to check for obvious issues, I.e. the devices should be in the same network. They are. Yet, I the app cannot find the scale. I tried resetting the scale, the network settings, and reinstalling the app. Nothing worked. The device is worthless without the app.

title: Can not log in
text: I was using this app to monitor my blood pressure. Then all of a sudden, the app told it was no longer free to me. Had to delete the app then reinstall it. I forgot my password. Tried to reset my password by entering my email address. Said email was sent to reset my password, the email never showed in my in box no matter how many times I asked for a reset. Now my blood pressure machine is useless because it will not without the app

title: Irritating UX
text: The app is irritating to use and I wish I’d bought a different Bluetooth BP device. It keeps refusing to take my measurements because it says I’ve already taken them today, even when I haven’t taken them in days. Why would you ever design a feature to refuse to take measurements? And worse, implement it incorrectly so it refuses when it shouldn’t. Disappointing, will look elsewhere for health tracking in the future.

title: Demands an account!
text: Edit: misunderstanding about the need of the account wanting my email password! I would still like to be able to run the device without an account! But as of this point it seems to be working as advertised! Still do not understand why an Apple Watch is not in a list as others have said.

title: Wireless scale lite
text: No complaints. It syncs fast with my phone. It recently updated software through the phone. Batteries last a long time. Bright big readout. Would recommend for those who just want weight, buy the other scale for more metrics. Would buy again. No issues with the app.

title: iHealth Bluetooth BP monitor/iOS works great
text: Great value for the quality and at least with my iOS iPhone 7, it along with my unrelated but compatible smart scale both work very well and I'm looking forward to future tech by iHealth, since it syncs data seamlessly to the Apple iOS Health UI app.  Great work, software engineers!

title: Bluetooth failure
text: My iHealth Feel Wireless Monitor has quit connecting automatically with my new iPhone 11. To use it with my app I have to open settings and connect manually. A real pain in the neck. When I tried uninstalling everything and starting over the app quit working saying my account did not exist even though I could go online with my laptop and sign in. In my opinion this product is one I would not use again after my experience.

title: I have a feeling the people who developed this app don't use the products.
text: This app could be amazing but it is not. Many flaws and no way to report them or get support. The most glaring is when you use the app to record your weight the screen locks. It won't do anything once it weighs you. You have to manually close the app by exciting and then swiping up. This is so annoying I am thinking about returning all the iHealth products not scale.

title: iHealth Core Scale
text:
I like the scale, but the body values are very questionable when compared to other more accurate methods or scales for body fat. 

There would be value in the scale recognizing the time of day when the measurement is taken to better identify trends.  

My next scale will have the hand sensors to get better body composition readings.

title: Worthless
text: I bought the blood pressure monitor only to find out that the app won’t allow you to use the device without creating an account with the company I have no idea why they need my email address birthdate and so much information but if I don’t feel inclined to share that information there is no way to use it the app will not let you just use the device to see your blood pressure without sharing your life story with the company

title: Turn the music off!!!
text: The music is so annoying I can’t even think!  Why?  It’s not necessary at all.  This will be returned if I can’t turn the music off and take care of my business in peace.  I weigh early in the morning when my spouse is sleeping, I can’t turn off my volume because I’m on call so unless you can offer an alternative I’ll be buying something else. Honestly, you may have a great app but I won’t listen to this music long enough to find out.

title: A really really annoying app
text:
Font, like so many app designers do, is a fine light grey and unreadable to me. IOS  has made such type nearly microscopic in recent upgrades, and it won’t stretch. 
   I have serious doubts about the scale accuracy but time will tell. 
Doesn’t interact with anything else: MyFitnessPal which I’ve used 5 years, nor Apple health app.  
  I entered my weight to Myfitnesspal manually for years I don’t need this terrible app. DELETE

title: Unable to Edit
text: This app does not allow you to edit your readings. I use my own BP device and must manually input my data. But should I click on the wrong wheel setting, it becomes a permanent record and I can’t change it. If I had that ability, it would get 5 stars.

title: Trouble with Bluetooth connection
text: I opened the package and followed all the directions as I have other iHealth devices.  It connected fine the first time but I haven't been able to connect the scale lite to the Bluetooth on my phone.  What could be the problem.  Help please. The glucose blood kit and app are outstanding.

title: Meh
text:
Dodgy software. 
Seemed to work when first arrived. After couple of months, keeps telling me I’ve already completed my test for the day and to return in the morning.  Except I haven’t used the unit for a few days. 
Other problem,  it will only take reading at certain times. If you try outside of those parameters, you won’t get reading.  
Don’t understand reasoning for the restrictions.

title: Wrong information in Czech translation
text:
Hi,are you realy sure that Office working is High activity in daily activity setting under account? Because you have it in Czech translation of this app.
What must be set for olympic sportsman’s or for miner?

Please correct.
Thank you

title: Good product
text:
I have had the BP cuff and app for about a year and I use it each morning and evening. It syncs with the app without issues and is accurate. I have checked it against an analog BP Cuff during my doc visit. 

If your into tracking your vitals this is worth the spend.

title: Order never showed up.
text: I think they are out of business. I placed order few weeks ago they said they will ship it 1-2 business days now it’s almost three weeks. I tried to reach them they don’t pick up their phone. I emailed them many times they don’t respond. Now I am looking my options. Don’t order any product through their website.

title: Why not private mode?
text: I bought a couple of your associated products and I used them in the past.  However, I stopped using your devices when I realized I really don’t want my vitals stored on a server for which  have no control.  Why don’t you include a private mode where my information is stored in a local file or at worst in my private iCloud account?   I really do not wish to share my information with your company.

title: Bluetooth
text: This App does work, you must make sure no other App is running on Bluetooth at the same time, I had another health app open in background and iHealth app would not connect to my cuff or scale

title: Good Work!
text: The software is easy to use, and the connection is fast. I am losing weight, the daily weight and target lines are useful to me, and I hope that the software can add some custom dietary adjustments to me that will be a good supplement!

title: Loses Data after Sync
text: I bought this to use with the iHealth blood pressure cuff. The cuff seems to work very well and I think it is accurate. However when you sync the data to this app it erases it from the blood pressure cuff and only stores the last reading in the app. Totally useless for looking at trends or past history. The app is a little clunky to use as well.

title: IHealth App
text: A great App!  I have been using it for years. I use it with my scale, blood pressure devise, and blood oxygen meter. I did have trouble pairing when I upgraded to iPhone X, but that was corrected on the last update. I recommend the app and the associated devises.

title: Network Error 102
text: Your application no matter what device used on  will not connect through network. Any network that I have access to. I bought the finger O2 meter so I could use it properly with this application and since the App connect the device is basically useless for gathering the history of data. it works as a device but that’s it

title: App is inactive in Health app
text:
Hello! I bought the blood pressure monitor it works perfectly but from few days ago it doesn't register the BP it appears inactive the app under Health app it doesn't store the results in the Health app from iPhone other than that works good. Is there anything you can do to fix this issue.
Thanks!

title: it’s ok, but.......
text: I have the iphone 11 and bought the ihealth wave after a recommendation. Once the phone was connected to the watch, I noticed that the step counts in the ihealth app doesn’t match the step count in the apple health app. It’s off by, at least, 3500 steps. I’m wondering how they would be able to sync up and record evenly.

title: Pulse Oximeter
text: I have a congenital heart defect that causes my oxygen saturation to be quite low. This allows me to track this and the app keeps the data for me so that I can know where I am as well as pull it up for my physicians. Only wish they offered an Apple Watch version.

title: Why is not syncing the app with my Health Apple App?
text: It’s a good product, but kind annoying because besides of seeing my readings in this app, I want also to be able to see in my Apple health App. I granted the permissions, but stills unable to see there. Any insights on to this?

title: Could not even register an account.
text:
Kept saying network error 999 on my iPad (which the app will not even support landscape mode). I would be using it on the iPhone, but it is easier to download, installs and register stuff on the iPad first.

I recommend trying the app (if you can get it to work) before buying any of the companies actual products.

title: Pretty easy to use and export my data to my doctor super easy
text: Like what iHealth claimed, take charge of your health. Sharing is easy , device is accurate.

title: Nice APP
text: This app is great at helping me stay within bounds each day. It's really helping me with my weight loss goals. It really works. I have been using it for a month and have lost 26 pounds. It's so easy to use.

title: This scale is awful.
text: Stay as far away from this scale as possible. After it requiring a lot of your personal info just to get it started, it only uses Kilos which is fine if you aren’t an American raised in Lbs as weight measurement. Even Stones as a measurement would have been ok. Just wanted a good accurate scale that you step on and get a result. This ones a giant pain.

title: Works very well with My iPhone
text: This is great!!! I’ve been able to record all of my blood pressure readings and send them to my doctor whenever necessary. So cool!!!

title: Won’t connect to Apple Watch
text: I’m not sure why Apple even allows this app? You have zero options to connect to Apple Watch. I’m not going to go out and spend another $500 for a specific set of watches your app allows. As far as I know, the Apple Watch is the only FDA approved heart rate monitor for the wrist watch series. Maybe allow it and stop monopolizing (which is illegal by the way).

title: Some stuff works, some doesn’t
text:
After a botched order probably on my part, the three items I ordered arrived. Scale, pulse/oxygen monitor and wrist blood pressure monitor. 2 out of three, the scale and the pulse monitor, seem to work fine but the wrist blood pressure device is a dud. Worked once, then nothing. 
It’s probably a good idea, poorly executed. I’d reconsider if I knew the devices failed so easily.

title: IHealth Wave
text: The iHealth unit is great......The wrist bands are weak and they break very easily. I have been trying to get a hold of them so I can buy replacement bands but I’ve been waiting now over a month for a response to my email or respond to my telephone call you think they would get back to you with the price, you would think they would get back to you quickly for the price they have this unit?

title: Not all data flows to Apple Health
text: I have the Nexus scale which records body fat, lean mass, body water, muscle mass, bone mass. The data transfers well to the iHealth app. Some of the data loads to the Apple Health app but not all.  For example, Lean Body Mass does not transfer even though the app is listed in the “Data Source” section.  This needs to be fixed.

title: iOS 11.1.1 fixed bug :)
text:
Originally: Can’t get the app to recognize the cuff on iPhone X. Love to rate this when that Happens!

Updated: working now. A little different readings from my Withings cuff. But who knows who’s right anyway? Much easier to get on than an upper arm cuff.

title: Doesn’t work
text: I create a new account and get network error 99 but my email box receives the “new account created”. Then I can’t log in. Done it several dozen times. My email is flooded with “welcome, congrats on creating a new account”. I’m about the return the blood pressure monitor to the store because the app doesn’t work. I wish this would work offline

title: App no longer connects to scale via Bluetooth
text: After the last IOS update, the scale connects to my phone via Bluetooth but the app won’t connect to the scale. It just displays a Bluetooth connection spinning icon. The readout on the scale has not been legible for some time so now it’s useless! Please fix the problem. I’m considering purchasing a different brand of scale!!!

title: Support is lacking
text: I love my Core scale and the fact that I can review the details in this app.  BUT, the time log is off and shows wrong times and even days, depending on when I weigh.  I tried contacting support, but they never replied.☹️

title: very disappointing
text: bought The iHealth blood pressure monitor clear their newest latest one thinking it work with your iPhone directly because all the ad show it and the iPhone side-by-side nothing else but no you have to have a home Wi-Fi service with someone for it to connect to then it goes to your phone through that does not connect straight to your phone's Wi-Fi

title: Works great with Apple Health
text: App easily imports data into Apple Health data base which is the main reason I purchased their oximeter.  Also good app privacy statement.

title: Weak
text: Bare minimum effort on this app to sell the expensive hardware. Hasn’t been updated in the many years that I’ve had it. Can’t look at older data. First orient the screen at all. Seriously lame software for the great hardware. The owners of this company should be ashamed of themselves. It wouldn’t take much cash outlay to improve this software immensely. Tight wads!

title: Awful
text: The devices show they are connected but the app states the devices are connected. Once in a blue moon the app will connect. Why Bluetooth settings show the devices are connected that the app won’t connect beats the heck out of me. I have tried restarting my phone, in pair and re-pair devices and  still the same issues.

title: Instacrashes
text: The app crashes immediately within 1-2 seconds of being started. Giving the amount of money I spent on a blood pressure monitor, and the fact that this app is the only way to control it, this is incredibly frustrating and disappointing. I’ll probably throw my monitor in the trash and buy another one.

title: Won’t connect to WiFi or set up properly
text: Over time either this app or the device won’t complete the setup ... most of the time my device finds my WiFi and then starts the setup process, but it fails to complete the setup every time. Fortunately the device works for taking my blood pressure, it’s just I can’t take advantage of the features in the app.

title: Do not ever buy an iHealth product
text: Rule#1 for a company making. Connected device- ensure device doesn’t fail repeatedly to connect to the phone. I bought a iHealth weight scale and the device fails to connect to my phone. I am pretty tech savvy, so this isn’t about user error but the device times ou constantly. No help or support from the company. Take your money elsewhere

title: So Far So Good
text: I have the need to have my blood pressure results handy at all times and this app works very well for me. There is no writing anything down, the app stores all your vitals. The Bluetooth blood pressure cuff is absolutely wonderful.

title: HS5 scale doesn’t connect
text: There is a new update of the app today, steal my scale HS5 cannot connect to the Apple or ios devices. It has been two months since I can’t connect my scale. I hope soon they can fix this issue so I can continue using my scale. It is really frustrating trying to connect the device.

title: Forces you to scan a barcode
