title: DO NOT BUY - GET A FITBIT INSTEAD
text: I bought this since I decided to start getting back in shape and trying a pedometer to help.  With the fitbit becoming so popular I loved that the iHealth Activity Monitor also tracked sleeping as well and was at a price easy to afford.  I set up after charging pretty easy.  I downloaded the app and setup my account.  I attempted to sync after the first day and found that my data did not transfer and it cleared my monitor.  I gave it another day of using it and it synced fine at the end of the day with no errors.   I thought it was great!  I woke up and put it on for the day since I hadn't gotten it figured out for sleeping yet.  That morning I had a blast of junk mail in my email. When I came home to try to sync it to the app the app told me my account had been deleted.  I had to setup my account again.  I tried to sync and all of the sudden the monitor was not connecting via Bluetooth.  I reset the device and uninstalled and reinstalled the app with no luck.  Since I had this thing for not even a week I am taking it back to where I purchased and will invest in a fitbit.  Obviously they figured out how to make consistent products with trust worthy apps.  This iHealth monitor and app are garbage.  Don't waste your money!!!

title: This app misses the mark
text:
The previous IHealth App for Blood Pressure worked like a charm. It had: Nice colorful graphs, Large easily readable fonts and graphs, and  Intuitive navigation.

This App: appears to have removed most all of the graphs, removed almost all of the color (now almost completely blue and white making it hard to easilty identify "good, at risk, and bad" results), Decreased the size of the fonts so that the text is more difficult to read (especially on an IPhone), and the navigation is not quite as intuitive as the previous app.

This app has tranisitioned into what I feel is nothing more than a glorified number tracker. I could use a spreadsheet and do the same thing with better results. The previous App was informative. The graphs and charts were useful in understanding and monitoring my BP

The only positives that I have found with regard to this app is that it combines the Blood Pressure and Weight monitoring into a single location and allows access to the information through multiple devices (web, iphone, ipad, etc.) Additionally, it can be used without purchasing the IHealth scale or BP devices. Finally, there appears to be a section that allows for goal setting and calorie monitoring. I have not used these parts yet.

In general I have been disappointed with the state of the current app. If IHealth would address some of these issues I would gladly reconsider this review and rating. Until then I can only give this app one star.

title: Extremely disappointing
text: I updated to this version of the iHealth app when I received a compatible scale for Christmas. I was immediately disappointed because I could not import my existing blood pressure data into the new app. Later, when I began using the scale, I was also disappointed to learn that I would have to manually connect (with Bluetooth) the scale to my phone every time I wanted to weigh myself. The app is buggy, it frequently crashes, and it is not intuitive. The calorie log portion of the app is nearly useless because it has no scanning feature and no easy way to enter foods that you eat often or foods that are packaged. It seems to me that this app was released before it was ready to go. It's a shame that the makers of the app didn't do a better job and get it right before releasing it to the public. One final word: if your purchase decision for the scale or the blood pressure monitor are based upon the usability of this app, don't buy.

title: First Class Medical, Again
text: Most of the negative iHealth MyVitals app are inaccurate, these are people not willing or patient enough to understand the simple protocol of using the iHealth devices. 1) You open the iHealth MyVitals app first, do nothing more. 2) Then turn on your iHealth Bluetooth device, and, then, 3) select that device within the MyVitals app, the Bluetooth pairing is immediate and the vitals/data recording is accomplished, instantly. The “old” MyVitals app is the same as the “new”, unchanged except for format size. The “new” app displays better on larger format devices, i.e. Apple’s iPad Pro, the “old” is easier to read on a much smaller screen, granted. If you’re not monitoring your health with iHealth Labs provisions (app & devices) and going for a walk, you’re missing out in promoting your own good health!

title: No Problem with my iPad 3
text: I have been using the cuff with my iPad 3 with no problems whatsoever.  It has been 6 months now and the app has conveniently stored all of my data with no losses.  I do have to re-pair the two in occasion, but that happens with all of my Bluetooth devices and I can't say Apple updates aren't to blame.  I love that the cuff holds a charge forever.  I have only had to charge it 2 times in 6 mos.  The app is very user friendly.  You can even add notes on each test to really narrow down that event or meal which elevated your bp.  I am looking forward to connecting my activity tracker to it.  Common sense tells me that I would save myself a headache trying to use this app and equipment with a newly develop device like my iPhone 6+ until the bugs are worked out.

title: Nice update!
text: This app is wonderful. There are so many devices available, and it easily syncs with your other health apps including the native health app. You can even upload your data to get reward points a Walgreen's! I have recommended this app and the various devices to my patients as a Family Physician. They can upload their data into my medical records system so that we can keep track. This decreases the number of times a patient has to visit, and increases compliance with required home vitals checking. I can also trust the automated devices because they are all standardized, and it mostly eliminates human error. I highly recommend this system, you won't regret it!

title: Noticeable improvement/change!
text:
UPDATE-----------------------------------
The all was just updated to support the iPhone 5 and it is much more pleasing on the eyes. I can tell some work has been going into this App! This is very nice to see :)   Unfortunately the app still has a funky design layout, but the improvement is pretty big! So I'm increasing my rating to 4/5 stars. 

Old-----------------------------------------
Product works great, but the app looks atrocious. Okay not atrocious...but for a $70 BP monitor you'd think they could at least make an app that is iPhone 5 optimized. Unfortunately this is a review of the app, not the product. Regardless, the app is not exactly clean, and it has a lot of pointless buttons. The app needs a new cleaner interface, and it needs to be iPhone 5 optimized big time. The withings app is much nicer, and frankly if somebody is buying a BP monitor with the key feature being "iPhone app sync", they will be embarrassed once they see this app. Yes, the functionality is there but it's dreadful to use. Especially with every other app on my iPhone 5 looking much better than this one.

If this app is updated I'll update my review.

title: Works, could be much better
text: While it basically works OK, it has some shortcomings: 1) too easy to delete a new BP measurement by mistake, only 1 tap with no request to confirm. 2) only way to exit after adding a note to a measurement is to tap Cancel—which is misleading, as it doesn't in fact discard your note. 3) needs too many taps for the most common use-case of taking a new BP reading—having detected a connected BP device, it should default to taking a new reading. Also, a comment about the iHealth BP3 device's charge-indicator LED: 1) it looks too much like an ON/OFF switch and confuses some users. 2) it goes suddenly from green (charged) to not having enough juice to take a reading, instead of turning yellow to show low battery.

title: Wheres the SpO2?
text: I bought the bp cuff and SpO2 monitor for my mother… I am really, really disappointed to find that these two devices can’t be tracked in the same app!  How can an app titled “MyVitals” not include a vital sign such as SpO2?  It’s hard enough to ask my parents to track vital signs digitally at home, it’s that much worse to make them juggle so many different apps (they have a fitbit scale).  All these apps not talking to each other is horrible- it’s a repeat of the problems hospitals and doctor's offices with their technology not being compatible. Also,  I have I’ve looked online, and can’t find any reference to the SpO2 function being put into the app soon.  I’d at least like them to be honest about things, not just cover over the fact that they’re missing such a logical feature.

title: Very good NSI
text:
Small attractive well packaged and well priced

Linked flawlessly with my iPhone on many tries. At first the heart rate was substantially low. 10 points below my measured pulse rate. This has corrected now. My BP's are taken quickly with quick recycle time. Reading display is excellent. The major flaw is the trend display where there's no scale and limited duration. Program would be much better if it gave average pressures and gave a good long-term display. ( I'm a cardiologist and recommend many BP home monitors and programs like Omron cuffs and I-BP which are my favorites still. But with a little software improvement this could be the one !
DR

title: ok but very buggy
text:
The scale worked ok when we first opened it, but only connected with one iOS device at a time. We have an iPhone and iPad 2 and want to use both but the scale only recognizes one at a time. This means you have to disconnect one device to connect the other, not a simple process.

I emailed customer support who responded quickly but were not very helpful. I had to explain the problem multiple times, with each time them telling me I could use both devices at the same time. When clearly I couldn't. I eventually gave up as they had no suggestions or solutions other than repeating the instructions.

So we've been using the app on one device however it started recording my wife and my weights under the same account (it was tracking them separately previously) so I tried to change devices this evening and now it won't connect to any device. Very annoying.

As a scale its weight measurements has ben pretty accurate. BMI has been pretty consistent for me, but all over the place for my wife.

Great idea but for $120 it should perform a whole lot better.

title: Huge disappointment.
text:
Been using the previous version for over a year with a BP monitor and was very satisfied. Recommended the app and BP monitor to a lot of people as I sell medical equipment. 

Just upgraded and newest version crashes, locks up, and fails to record. Bluetooth has to be restarted constantly and have to restart the app. If I am lucky I can get one reading a day. I am supposed to record 4 times a day. Very, very buggy application. 

People will rely more and more on medical apps to help self monitor their own health. Releasing new versions of health care software that people count on, before it's ready, especially when a previous version worked just fine is a great way to put yourself out of business but more importantly, to put peoples' health at risk. Very disappointing.

title: Works on iPhone 4S but not on the 5S
text: I was starting to get annoyed with this app along with iHealth MyVitals 2.0 because both would freeze and become useless I also have the Wireless Blood Pressure Wrist Monitor which would stop working during the middle of testing and displayed the solid red square indicator on top meaning "Abnormal state" according to the manual.  Neither App works with my iPhone 5s I even did a complete restore on the 5s. Then I decided to try my old iPhone 4s and surprisingly it works just fine.

title: Excellent system!
text: I have had this for a year and it is perfect. In the first year I used the wrist blood pressure cuff and the weight scale. Both worked great with my iPhone 6. I had a stroke in early December and my cardiologist wanted me to use an arm cuff so I ordered one. The blue tooth connection was simple. I've also changed along with their app updates and haven't had any problems. I love this setup and would never go back to a regular analog blood pressure or weight measurement device again. I have not used the exercise wrist device so I can't advise on that.

title: User unfriendly and intermittent.
text: Bought BP cuff, weight scale and oxipulse. Each device requires a different procedure to communicate with MyVitals. The weight scale requires two steps, the BP cuff requires four.   The awkwardness of the the interfaces, inconsistency between device procedures, and the sometimes iffy auto-pair Bluetooth technology are significant challenges to ease of use. The app's UI is rather complicated as well. After spending a half hour with a support tech, I ironed out some of these hurdles. The tech admitted that Bluetooth technology is by its nature imperfect and prone to hiccups, but I've had few problems with BT earphones, car interfaces, or keyboard/mice.  Admittedly, the iHealth devices are more complex, but ultimately usability depends on ease of use.  IHealth has a ways to go.

title: Set-up a Breeze
text: First time user. Seeing all the negative feedback, I was a bit apprehensive. But the app on my iPhone 6 connected immediately to my HS5 iHealth body scale and all my readings went straight to the Health app, which is what I use for tracking. I created an iHealth account for my wife, and as soon as she stepped on the scale it registered her as "user 2" and logged her data separately to her iPhone 5. It's important to follow the details in the setup instructions, both for the peripheral device and for the app. Works great for me.

title: Awful app
text: This app is awful.  I would give it zero stars but that is not an option.  I have the BP monitor and the scale.  It rarely connects to the scale and when it does connect, it rarely saves the data.  It is not user friendly and is difficult to navigate.  Manual entry is slow and cumbersome.  You will need the manual entry since it is so poor at connecting and recording the data.  Manual entry uses scroll wheels, which are slow and tedious when compared to entering data with a pop up numerical keypad.  The old version of the BP app is much better since it uses the numerical keypad for entering data.  This app is a huge step backwards when compared to the previous iHealth BP app.  In conclusion, this app is awful!

title: Congratulations, managed to break it
text: This current version no longer works with my BP monitor under iPhone 6/iOS8.1.1. The developers managed to break the app as it did work with the previous iHealth version. In the Bluetooth setting, the BP monitor is listed at the bottom (in the not connected, no info "i" button present; no way to hit " forget about this device") and I can't get the device to be listed in the "recognized list", let alone have it connect to BT. No matter what, it keeps telling me "the device needs to be within range..." while I have the BP monitor within a few inches from the phone. Back to the drawing board to please figure out where you steered off.  Thanks.

title: Useless as ever
text: I have been using this application for a few years and have been "working around" it's bugs" but to release a new version with "increased health kit support" ... if that means breaking the integration then you've accomplished that goal. NOTHING gets recorded to the HealthKit now. I relied on the various items I own such as the scale and blood pressure cuff to write to the HealthKit as I have automatically upload the info to my physician. now there's nothing. at least the glucometer still works, today. Guys, please get your act together. Withings is top notch and considered the gold standard. I will drop you off like a bad habit if you don't fix this once and for all.

title: Innovative, convenient. Lots of potential.
text: My need was simple; a convenient way to take and track my BP. It does a fine job of that. The BP screen uses a simple combination of data and graphics. The history and trends stored on my iPhone4 are super-convenient to identify patterns (e.g. times of day when it's higher) and have something to show the Dr during the annual physical exam.  I like it.  I'm sure the company will continue to evolve the UI as comments come in, but it easily hits my "good enough to use" bar as is.

title: Doesn't keep it's sync
text: I purchased the scale that is supposed to use this app and have only had problems.  The directions on how to sync the two are confusing. Also, once you get it figured out...it takes a few tries to get it to work even with the correct procedures...and finally things work nicely..Then...another all that trouble....they get disconnected and must be synced all over again. If you want to continually sync your scales with the app, then you'll love this.  But if you're like me and find it bothersome to manually enter the info or to manually sync the scale to the app...don't purchase either!

title: Roller wheels
text: It doesn't make much sense to be able to, with the roller wheels, change between kg(s), lb(s) and st in the body weight but not in food diary.  The food diary roller wheels only display the weight that you select for your body weight.  And I do know that you can go to settings and change settings.  I am always going to weigh myself in the same unit but when I am entering food sometimes it would be nice to be able to change the unit measurement without going to the settings.  For this reason I would hold off buying any of the accessories that can be used with this app until they fix this problem.

title: I would not recommend this product!
text: I found this this device is very inaccurate, I followed the directions and compared it with my doctors in-office device and the numbers signifiganly different. I attempted to contact iHealth 4 times during their regular busines hours to no avail, after hearing the lenghty recoreded message and pressing 1 to speak with support I was disconnected on each attempt. Lastly, no where in the directions or manual does it tell you to download a "new" app to sync the data and use the device I had to research it on my own. If you want to try this product this is the app you need to use: iHeath MyVitals

title: It's ok!!!
text: App would be even better if it linked up on its own and updated my activity and sleep that way. Bluetooth stays on yet I have to try over and over to sync my data. Not sure why it doesn't do it automatically. I also can not track anything I've eaten if it isn't given as an option to choose from. I'll stick with it for a little while to see how it goes. I hope they make improvements.

title: A little effort and it works
text: It takes a little work, but it works. Scale must be on solid floor, not carpet nor rug. It does connect to MyFitness Pal, however you must go online to completely set everything up for both. Haven't finish reading the manual, But figured most of this out by just reading the prompts as they popped up. I picked this over the Fitbit scale, and I'm happy with my selection. My scale/app are connected to my iPad mini.

title: Love it
text: I've been using the original Health BPM app and just downloaded this. I only own the Blood Pressure Dock but now am considering purchasing one of their scales. This is a great tool for keeping track of all your Blood Pressure, Weight and Calorie intake all through one App. The App is also integrated with Evernote and sends over specialized notes of your results if you choose to.

title: Can't use at all
text: I bought this app after open heart surgery last year to keep track of my vitals to use with my iPhone 4. Could never get it to connect with the device. When I contacted customer support, I was told to "clear my cache" because of a "network timeout" message. Didn't help. I been bought a new iPhone 5 since I was due for a new phone anyway thinking that might help. Same problem. It's as if the monitor can't recognize my phone's Bluetooth signal. Complete waste of too many dollars and putting up with condescending emails from  useless customer support.

title: Worked great right out of the box
text: I downloaded the app, turned it on, paired  it with Bluetooth and it's worked great every time. You don't even have to open up the app to use it. As soon as you turn on the device it pairs with Bluetooth and opens the app.  I've been keeping track of my BP for a number of years and this BP monitor seems accurate.

title: HS5 now showing incorrect body fat percentage
text:
After this update I've noticed that my body fat percentage is about 10% higher than before. I have another scale and it along with the Omron body fat analysis agree but the HS5 is off. Did this update change any firmware or functionality of the scale?

EDIT: After the last update the body fat measurement returned to normal. Thanks for the quick fix.

title: Just inaccurate
text: My wife is an RN and we checked my blood pressure with the iHealth wireless blood pressure wrist monitor versus her BP cuff and stethoscope.  The iHealth monitor was consistently off (anywhere from 20 - 30 points).  While waiting on device to charge I decided to enter my dietary diary and couldn't find any of the food I ate today.  It also didn't allow me to add food.  Well that's about worthless.  I really wanted this to work.  I wanted to take BP and have the record automatically entered into my iPad... Maybe the technology just isn't there yet.  I went back to my wife taking BP and entering it into a spreadsheet.

title: When it work It's great
text: I've had the iHealth BP Cuff AND BPArm Band for at least 3 years. It's always been a hassle to get the Bluetooth to pair.  I LOVE it when it works because it gives you a full picture of your BP over time on its own APP. However, it's not sending data to the Apple Health APP. It seems that this company doesn't have enough engineers to keep up with updates from Apple. I wish I could give it 5 stars but after multiple contacts via eMail with the company, I'm still waiting for an improvement.

title: Difficulty connecting to iPhone
text: Multiple people are trying to use bp wrist monitor and in order for it to connect we have to 'forget this device' in Bluetooth settings and start all over when ever a different person wants to use it... It should just connect on one device after all the other devices 'Bluetooth' is turned off but it doesn't... What a pain

title: Great app
text: This app is really amazing. Works really well with my BP-3 and also love being able to manually enter and track other things like weight. I would give 5 stars but the latest update has an annoying alert that says to turn on Bluetooth every time you open the app. I don't have any BT devices so very annoying. Otherwise really nice app even if you don't have the fancy gadgets.

title: NEW VERSION A REAL STEP BACK!!!
text: So sorry you changed the look. Might seem artistic to the designers but it is much more difficult to read. The very light colors make letters less distinct. "List mode" is much harder to view making it more difficult to share with a physician. You can no longer see notes on the same screen in list view. I use this every day and I'm so disappointed. Please consider a redesign that makes data easier to read (please include notes in list view). If you can't do a redesign, please allow us to download the old app.  Thanks!

title: Great app to use with activity tracker
text: I have no complaints after 1 month of use. The app works really well. I use it daily to sync my iHealth activity tracker with my iPhone and to enter my meals and weight. I love how you can set goals and track your progress. It has really helped me to put my health as a top priority. I recommend highly!

title: New version much worse
text: The prior version of iHealth showed promise, was easy to customize, was easy to input data and sync sources of data. But the new version eliminates all those conveniences and is extremely difficult to use. Not at all user friendly. I cannot get it to read data from Motion 24/7, but not problem with the old version. I cannot get it to read data from my Garmin Vivofit or the related Garmin Connect app.  It no longer has food data from Myfitnesspal. The list goes on and on, but this app has become useless.

title: Scale ok, App - VERY POOR
text: When it works, it's very simple to use... the problem is, that only for the first week of ownership.  EVERYDAY i send 15 mins or more trying to get the app to reconize the reading from the scale.  I called the customer suppert and they all kinds of reasons (too many apps open, peer memory on my phone, power down and reboot every morning, etc., etc.)  NOT very practical, nore was it taking any ownership that maybe they need to update thier app with a bug fix.  If have not buoght the hardware yet.. I would pass and get the FITBIT on.  Works everytime I step on the scale.

title: Useless out of the box
text:
My brand new iHealth BP5 never even attempted to inflate the cuff when I hit the Start button in this app. It just makes a single clicking noise and then reports a pneumatic system problem.
---
Update: I contacted the company's support, described the issue and made it clear it was brand new in a sealed shrink-wrapped box. They suggested either the internal engine or cuff are damaged, and said "there is no cure beyond seeking out a local repair technician." In other words, if they sell you a defective product, you must find someone to repair it at your own expense. Caveat emptor.

title: Perfect
text: Works perfectly on my iPhone six.  Linking is a cinch. Within a few points of the doctor's office stats for my blood pressure. The website where this item is sold gives the device a four and a half star rating. I'm not sure why so many users here are having issues.

title: Frustrating /Brutal
text: The app and web content are a huge waste of time (the app just has links for questions or support), there is zero content that is helpful for guidance on managing the recoded data.   I've invested in the BP monitor and the body analysis scale. I'm regretting my decision. If the scale/bp monitor/ and app should somehow not correctly all sync together on which individual is using a particular device, then nothing is transferred to the profile in the application. Great in concept, but lacking greatly in execution.

title: Great scale but app needs a little work
text: I like the scale and the data presented in the app which is the main reason I bought this device. I was excited when I opened the app and saw a calorie tracker as well. Compared to other calorie trackers I was disappointed. It does not have a barcode scanner, restaurants are not listed and I couldn't find  some of my popular brands.

title: Won't sync iOS 8.0.2
text: Looks like I'm going to Walgreens to get a refund! This watch doesn't sync with any of it apps on iOS 8.0.2 this watch is between $59 and $79. I tried three different watches. It's either watch or the app. Since the app makes the watch function they both are useless at this point. This company has very poor customer service and when you call the support number they always say "an error has occurred" how could Apple allow an app like this in their App Store? This company is very misleading!

title: What the heck happened to this app?!
text:
This app worked at one point, now it reads, network timed out every time I try and login. I have deleted and re-installed over and over. May I have a refund for the scale, and blood pressure cuff since I can no longer use them?
This would not allow me to post this review with less than three stars!!

title: Are you kidding?
text:
Device seems to work fine. However, the app need a little bit of work. They could start by taking the team that coded "My Vitals" out to a land fill somewhere. The app renders the BP device very close to useless as most users will likely take the blood pressure and pulse data to input into another application, which begs the question, "What was the point?" The app needs to be more than a not very well thought out after thought.

Dear iHealth Executives,

Do your self a favor, kill the app and whoever coded it. Any (15) year old programmer you might hire off the street can certainly do better. Keep in mind, "You can't fall off the floor."

Again, if you would please, please be so kind as to consider, without an appropriate application to store and analyze the BP device's data, your company has missed the point.

title: Good Product, Bad Technology and Business
text:
I had tried to stick with the product, because it has good product specifications.  However, the rest of the company is not up to par.  

The manufacturing leave much to be desired.  I have had to return the body analyzer scales four times; and based on error messages and the company wanting the scale back, I point to technology.  There is no one weak point; WiFi, bluetooth, composition sensor and weight sensor have all gone bad.  I have also had issues with the Glucometer.

Their support also has issues.  They never pick up the phone.  When contacting them, they try to blame the issue on the customer.  Only after long issues and after you ask for specifications, they go to their engineers to find out there is an issue.

I am going to use Withings.

title: Love it
text: After reading the reviews I was a little worried, but the app, the iHealth Blood Pressure monitor worked fantastically.  It took a little bit of time to charge the unit, but then it was just fine. I also liked how it showed the information online and how it feeds into to the Apple health App.

title: Works fine for me
text: I don't know what all the one and two star reviews are all about. I installed the app, charged the blood pressure monitor and it worked fine just as advertised right out of the box. I've only had it a few days, so will check back if any problems develop. Using iPhone 6+ iOS 9.3.2

title: Wrist monitor
text: IHealth please fix your app. I have a pretty new wrist monitor for blood pressure. It worked at first. I can't get it to work anymore. It won't read that my arm is in the correct position so it won't measure. Or it starts to measure and then it aborts the measure. Please fix. It would be a wonderful app if it worked consistently. The device is too expensive and only works with iOS so it's useless if the app doesn't work.  It's raising my blood pressure by challenging me!

title: IHealth My Vitals
text: This is a great app when it is working correctly. However, even with latest bug fixes, it takes at least two attempts to sync the tracker with the app; it crashes several times while syncing. It is definitely worth having. The developers WILL get it right!

title: Good but deleting needs fixing
text: The app does what it says but they need to fix delete.  It is directly next to the test button in the bottom so I keep accidentally deleting.  It needs to ask you to confirm the delete or something because it is too easy to accidentally delete.

title: Crashes a lot
text:
Since the update this app freezes up every time I try to use it. iPhone 5 running iOS 9.3.1. Up until now I used this app every day to monitor blood pressure and weight.

Update:
I was told by iHealth that their developers have found some issues with the app, when using the latest build of iOS (9.3.1)... Especially, if the user has performed a Factory Reset of their device.

iHealth has a fix waiting for the next iOS 9.3.2 release. A refund was offered if my device was purchased within the 365 day limited warranty period. I've had this for over a year. I'm outta luck until the Apple update. 

On a positive note... iHealth has responded within 24 hours to all my correspondence.

title: Like the blood pressure wrist monitor hardware.  App is poor.
text:
I like the blood pressure wrist monitor hardware.  Works great.  Five stars for that.  

The app is confusing.  User experience is poor and disorganized. 
Needs to be rethought.

---Update after a few weeks use: ---
I have the wrist monitor. The readings seem to vary a lot, even when I take repeated readings one after another without removing the device. 

iHealth needs to improve the blood pressure trend graphs. Terrible. Put a sensible scale and grid lines so you actually read the graph!  Graph should include ALL measurements, not just one per day. Should be able to see how BP varies over a day. Should be able to zoom in/out on the time axis. Don't need vertical lines connecting systolic and diastolic

title: Finally integration but forcing people to use iHealth Cloud
text: Finally they integrated the the apps, but I did not want to use their iHealth cloud and now they are forcing people to use it rather than the correct option or either using it not. It should be fully functional without using their own web hosted service! I would rather see integration with iCloud and have the data synchronized to all my devices that way. They need to fix this immediately!

title: The app needs improvement
text: I like the app when I use my pulseoximeter but I wish it could also record the pulse wave not just show only the stats when your done. It doesn't give you the option to record the wave. Please add the capability to record in live time the pulse wave. Until then I only giving this app 3 stars.

title: Improvement
text: After updating to the latest version of the app when synchronizes sleep data and the crash not happen.

title: None responsive customer support
text: I purchased a blood pressure wrist monitor which is used by this app.  The device consistently provides an inaccurate reading. I have exhausted efforts to resolve the problem my following the instructions provided with the device.  I have made several efforts to contact customer support.  Phone calls go to voice mail and emails are not answered.  Be aware that if you purchase any products from this company you are doing so at a risk.

title: Rather than updating to support an unreleased product, how about you support existing users?
text: The app worked pretty well on iOS 8, I like how connecting my cuff opened the app. I HATE the fact that you cannot do measurements without giving them your data, that is BS. The app crashes immediately on iOS 9- how about you fix this first before actually issuing support for a product I can't even buy yet?

title: Excellent App when paired with the Tracker and/or Scale
text:
Thoroughly enjoying the daily data on my activity and sleep. Would love to see the Daily Diary "beefed up" a bit like adding a spot for mood, medication/supplement intake and a note section so I can write any pertinent information for that day.  
Great job folks, keep up the good work.

title: Works just fine
text: Wow, the barrage 1- 2 star reviews make me wonder if all these people know each other! I have the Body Analysis scales and the blood pressure wrist monitor and they, and the app, work great. The app syncs fine with both the apple health app and the iHealth web portal.

title: Seems to become better than before
text: The upgrade is successful,Compared to the previous version,it was easier to use.

title: Awful is all I can say.
text: The previous app worked flawlessly. Now I get inconsistent connectivity to my BP monitor. The new GUI is also a step backwards and I agree with a previous reviewer point on why should I have to log in to take My BP. Bring back the old version for iOS. This new app makes me want to abandon this device and never look at another ihealth device again. Oh and while I'm on my pedestal the phone support needs some major help also.

title: My Activities Appliance/App
text: After fixing some previous problems, iHealth has stumbled badly with the release of the latest version of this app. After you open the home screen in landscape, the individual parts of the app only open in portrait mode. Once that happens, the home screen is obscured and can't be used and you can't close the portrait window rendering the app useless. There is no fix and all you can do is close the app.

title: iHealth Issue
text: I have been using this app almost since it came out with no difficulty and great results. After upgrading to IOS9 it quits when it tries to link to my scale. I’ve tried a few things to get it to keep running and record my weight but nothing I’ve done so far is working.

title: Wonderful
text: I use this app for tracking my blood pressure. I didn't even have to pair anything, it paired automatically as soon as I opened the app.  Highly recommend (at least for the blood pressure part).

title: Cloud Sharing Required!
text:
Want to check your blood pressure? First you have to create an account, provide them your full name, date of birth, height and weight to create a cloud account, then it will upload all your health data up there. How could that possibly go wrong?

Seriously, can I please just check my blood pressure locally on my phone? I don't need/want yet another cloud account that can have my data hacked and/or abused by marketers.

title: One of the better wellness apps out there
text: Although it only works with the iHealth stuff, it works pretty good and has some cool features like the ability to email results from the App.

title: Data corrupted
text: Don't trust the app. All my past entries shown on my iPhone were totally incorrect. Somehow they all got changed and all my data is totally corrupted. There are so many screw-ups that I can't even figure out why it may have changed. I do have a good download dated January 7, 2013. Obviously something happened after that. Probably some incompetent software coding. Stay away from this app. I would give it 0 stars if I could.

title: App crashes repeatedly
text: I love this app when it works. Mostly, it just crashes when you try to see your stats. It also has a hard time connecting to the scale. I've contacted the developers and they were slow to respond and couldn't replicate my problem. When my app works, my husband's won't. When his works, mine won't. Very very frustrating.

title: Good update.
text: This is the first time in a long time the ihealth apps have worked properly for my iPhone 6 plus. Good job guys. Keep it up. It seems like there's added functionality too.

title: Not ready for prime time
text:
I'm an iOS developer myself so I hate writing negative reviews so I'm going to be as specific as I can be.

I give it a one-star rating because I have an iPhone 5 and I purchased the Bluetooth weight scale. In essence, I just bought a $100 weight scale. It doesn't connect to my phone and I'm not going to flip the scale everytime I want to connect and record my weight. 

The app looks great and I'm sure it would be nice to use over time, but the app is useless without the body data.

The iPhone 5 has been out long enough that this issue should have been fixed already. Not fixing it indicates a lack of company leadership, I'm sure the developers can fix it easily.

title: Back to normal
text: So far so good, the last update brought things back to normal. I like using the App, gives me a good overview for some of mine activities and connects well with the blood pressure monitor. Better graphs with buttons for recent, week, month, and year.

title: Change of Heart
text: The first time I opened the new version I was unhappy, after using it for a while I think it is much better then the previous version.

title: App freezes when taking blood pressure
text: Having same experience as others for past 10 days. Reported to the support email and they told me to remove app and reinstall. I did. But same problem. I wish they would respond with a fix I can download ASAP.

title: New Version is Worse
text: i liked the interface of old version better.  have some bugs in new version with multiple users.  need to be able to transfer readings from one user to another since it auto imported to the wrong user

title: Can't track my progress!!
text: With the previous version, one could set a goal and track his/her progress. For example if your goal were to lose 10 lb in 4 weeks, it will draw a trend line and let you know if you were above or below the line as you progress. This new version does not have this feature.

title: Totally Disappointed
text:
I wanted an app that tracked vitals wirelessly and this app seemed like the perfect solution, as it was "supposed" to work with the iPad 2. However, I needed to purchase the wireless devices, BP, Glucose, etc.  The app constantly crashes when I try to research and review the devices needed to purchase for use with the app.  Requested support help and haven't received any response/help/answers.

I will update this review as things develop or not......

title: New iHealth app is terrible
text: The new iHealth app is terrible. It forces you to create an online account and sign in. I have news for you Mr iHealth, I don't want an online account and do not want to share my private health information with you or Apple or anyone else. I just want to connect my iphone to my iHealth scale and other devices to privately track my weight and blood pressure etc. This forced update is absolutely terrible.

title: Why did u ruin this app?
text: First, you have two of these apps- which has always been confusing. However, the blue one before u changed it, used to work. It knew my scale and it updated automatically all I would have to do is step on. Now nothing detects my scale- the apps are hard to read and don't work. Seriously go back to the previous versions- there is no improvement.

title: Very happy with it so far.  Needs privacy settings.
text:
I like that this is wireless and small.  Great when traveling.  It hooks up real fast with my phone as soon as I enable Bluetooth. 

It seems pretty accurate.  I get similar readings on my other blood pressure cuff.

I would like to see better privacy settings.  This data is for my consumption only to be shared with my doctor only.  A password to open the app is a must.  Also, specific settings as to how and where the data is stored and shared is a must.  

Add security and I will give it 5 stars.

title: Works fine
text: Connects with all my IHealth tools without any issues.  I'm using the wifi scale, activity monitor, BP Cuff, and the 02 meter. I like how everything ties together in one app and Apple Health (and I use the glucose meter in the glucose app).

title: Misses the mark
text: I've been using My Fitness Pal for years and love it.  The concept of an iHealth dashboard was good.  But for an app promoting healthy choices, there are an awful lot of processed foods listed!  I can't find most of the foods I use in My Fitness Pal.  I know you can sync them, but it seems to only go one way.  I'd like MFP to be able to send info TO iHealth, not just receive from.

title: Bad product. Bad service.
text:
Wrist product worked for two days. Then ceased to register correct position, meaning it won't take my blood pressure. 

Contacted iHealth and was refused a return option until my fourth request. They sent a return label and RMA, but after two days, eliminated them so they were no longer accessible at the links they provided. They then ignored my requests for further service. 

Avoid.

title: Great expectations
text: So I bought a hundred dollar scale that has it's own app.  Apparently they spent more time on the hardware than the programming!  The app crashes after one input in the calorie counter.  And it has no ability to distinguish between my wife's iPhone and mine.  And then the calorie counter is by the ounce instead of a generic guess at what a typical example of food is.  Hope you already have a food scale as well!

title: IPhone 6 Bluetooth issues
text: So disappointing!  Bluetooth doesn't work with iPhone 6.  Bluetooth works great with my old iPad mini, no issues there.  Wish they would fix this because it's a great and convenient way to check your BP!

title: Yea! An activity tracker that works for me!
text: I discovered the WAVE! It tracks walking, sure, but also lifting and, (here's the good part!) swimming! Just tried it in both pool and hot tub, kept track of distance. I'm super excited!

title: Yes Keeps info
text:
keeps manual input info, but that is where it ends. I bought mine about 1 year ago for the first 4-5 times I used the unit with my iPhone or iPad worked fine, then the software refused to recognize the Blood Pressure unit or Weighting scale.  After a month or so I tried again, back in the junk box to recycle for parts.
Do not waste your money or time with these products or software.

title: Great hardware but terrible software.
text: The BP7 hardware is great but the app really needs to be redesigned. The UI isn't iOS like at all. Everything about it is simply unintuitive. Once you figure it out it all works but figuring in it out in the first place is a bit ridiculous. I really hope that iHealth spends some time and redesigns the application because it could be a great app.

title: 3 days of perfect use. Then one big mess.
text:
App and device worked perfect for 3 days straight, multiple times a day. 

Now the app crashes non stop. It becomes completely unresponsive. Start button does nothing most of the time. The 1/10 times it starts the device the app freezes up and the cuff stops inflating and a red indicator light comes on. 

I have deleted and reinstalled the app several times now. Changes the HealthKit sync setting. I even tried running the app with Bluetooth off and it still locks up. 

I wanted to like. I wanted to USE it..... Unfortunate I will have to return it as defective unless the app gets fixed in the next week.

title: Hirrible
text: OMG!  This is a horrible piece of software. I have had this for a week now and have managed to get the scale to function twice with the phone.  Finally figured out how to input my data manually; not very intuitive.  Finally, good luck if you want to put your target weight in.  I need 190lbs and as soon as I hit the number 1, it disappears. So, looks like this scale wants me to GAIN weight, not lose it.

title: Nice App
text:
Is a nice app but the food database is limited and miss the sugar information, cholesterol, etc.
Also you need to use a different app for measure your sugar level, will be nice to have all devices in one app.
Per general the app is not bad and it look very promising. 
Good job, I hope you will still develop the app.

I need to update the review with some issue related with sleep track, sometimes when you sync, it created track for the same night in 3 or 4 copies, that is messing your entire track graphic and unfortunately it is no way that you can delete those duplicates.

title: Fabulous app but errors sometimes  happened
text: Being able to track how long I swim with my friends makes it really interesting,I like it a whole lot!!

title: Works as promised
text: Purchased wrist BP device a few days ago and downloaded this software for use with iPhone 6s. Works flawlessly so far - no complaints.

title: Bring back the Old
text: I am really not fond of this version. I like many of the functions of the previous version. I really miss most the fact that the app no longer gives me an average of my blood pressure.  I hate that every time the app launches it tells me how to connect my Bluetooth device that I do have have.  I wish I could go back in time and NOT update.

title: Key problems that need to be fixed
text:
I really wanted this app to work since I love the watch. Sadly it's got Bluetooth sync issues in that many times it crashes during a sync. I've had to restart multiple times to get the Bluetooth to sync with the app on an iPhone 6.

Please fix this app!

title: OK, needs work
text:
Calorie Tracker NOT iCloud compatible, can't use data on multiple devices.  No ipad app, just iPhone, so interface is only portrait on ipad.  Has lots of potential, but needs tons of work to be very useful.
It does work with the iHealth scale, but really won't do much more than that until they add some key features.

title: Update this App!!!
text: When the only model number available is the last and not the current model you have not worked at both ends.  I have received a model being sold as new that was obviously used and your software doesn't recognize it.  Also format this software for the total iPad user, portrait is awkward for tablet users in general.

title: Very pleased
text:
I am very pleased. The app works great. It will not start unless the monitor is correctly positioned. And it is illustrated very well. 

The readings are also consistent with those taken at the doc's office.

title: The App is Really Bad...
text: Its unbelievably bad: I can't register using facebook ("network error" - while I clearly have a good connection); I can't register using e-mail/password either ("website error"). Meanwhile, on mobile safari, I can login via facebook just fine. How a company can make such good looking and efficient products with such a worthless software is beyond me.

title: Works great after troubleshooting!
text: I also had issues with it connecting to my iPhone.  The setup was very easy but I figured out I had to cycle power on my wireless router for it to work.  This is an issue with DNS/DHCP and the routers buffers.

title: Good app, but needs improvement
text: The app is great when it works. The new version constantly crashes, especially when I try to upload offline data. It gets really annoying when all you want to do is a simple task and he keeps shutting down on you.

title: Missed it by *that* much!
text:
OK, neat concept but not ready for prime time. 

1. C'mon guys - not a universal app?  feels kind of silly balancing my ipad and keyboard on their side to use this!

2. Feels like there should be "under construction" signs outside of HR, BP and weight. I would need to buy other apps and/or devices to accurately track calories in and out then manually add the data to this system. 

Having said that, the BP monitor appears accurate ( I can check it against a manual BP cuff) and the BP cuff is quite simple to use.  Good luck with continuing development!

title: Update ruined the app...
text:
Wasted the morning figuring out that the update last week was the problem.

It could have been worse: Data from HS5 (weight and derivatives) and BP5 (blood pressure) devices are still recorded but now do not appear in the dashboard.

iHealth was always a poor balky app but the last update has made it worse.  And Apple shares the blame for permitting this screwup...

title: I lost 170 pounds TODAY
text: The latest software update forgets the basic principal that children will touch your stuff. My 9-year-old weighed himself last night, after I was asleep, and the results were posted to MyFitnessPal and Apple Health! Please replace the SMARTs that the old version had. It would look at the data collection and logically decide if it was my data or NOT MY DATA!

title: Waste of time and money
text: App has terrible UI that's a pain to use, Evernote integration constantly requires authorization when you try to log in. Can't even access the partner services on their web app to add other services anymore and customer service is the kind that just stops replying to your emails because they can't be bothered!

title: It's okay
text: I would of given 5 stars if this app would let you print out results from month to month! Don't understand why they wouldn't  include where you can print out results.  It's rather stupid.

title: Great app that needs major tweaks
text: I like this app so far.I do wish that it had a place for devices simple to connect.I hope the designers are working on an update.

title: Quirky
text: The app is very quirky.  It will work for long periods they just stop connecting to the arm cuff correctly.  It is particular annoying in that it always blames the user for "arm/wrist" movements even when sitting on a table top.  Once the software connection is ironed out this will be a great product.  Right now it is very frustrating.

title: Bluetooth connectivity problem
text:
I have a BP5 BP monitor that's supposed to connect to iPhone in order to check the blood pressure (the BP reading is displayed only in the app). 

In 9 of 10 instances, BP5 shows connected in list of Bluetooth devices in iOS Settings but does not show up in the app. I have to reset the BP monitor, as FAQ instruction, by pressing physical Start/Stop button of the BP machine. 

I am trying to love this product/app because it's BP readings are automatically entered in iOS Health app unlike Philips  Healthcare Suite app. 

I hope this connectivity issue is resolved soon and will reconsider the low rating I am giving.

title: Love it
text: I am enjoying this app and my Wave very much. It has helped me a lot keeping track. I haven't tried the exercises or the swimming guide but I am looking forward to trying them.

title: Works great but no SpO2
text: The app works great. I've been using it with the wired BP cuff and now the wireless. I just wish the SpO2 worked with it and didn't have to have a separate app.

title: really bad UI
text: Useful for keeping track of measurements, but incredibly bad UI. Screen elements are removed for no reason. Information is presented but when you tap on it nothing happens. So many different ways to get to different screens it’s hard to know where you are.

title: Easy to use
text: The process to use it is so smoothly. Will keep using it to record and monitor my health!

title: Good start!!!
text: Very responsive, fast and easy connection every time.  Would be nice if you could have the new pulse oximeter graph and results in ihealth MyViyals app and able to take a reading from this app.

title: Lost data, forced to use Facebook
text: After purchasing their blood pressure cuff and recording data for a year, the app suddenly stops working.  The only way I can use my cuff is to give them my Facebook friends list?  I wish this is illegal based HIPA compliance compliance.  I paid a lot for the blood pressure cuff and never wanted to let this company spy on me.

title: Failure after update
text:
So after the latest update the scale would weight only with no communication with scale. Attempting to reset wifi password results in time out. Tried replacing batteries but now have a Err 0 and unable to use scale at all.

Tech support says this is a unknown issue and have offered to replace the scale. I appreciate this very much, but I am afraid I will find myself with the same issue as this is obviously a screw up with the update and not the physical scale itself.

Make sure to give your software engineers a raise for a job well done as I know have a scale that's worthless.

Good Job!

title: Works great
text: Does it's job well and accurately. Connection with wrist BP monitor is always solid. Wish I could just monitor heart rate Bpm without doing a whole BP test. Great app still nonetheless.

title: Requires email cloud login, scale doesn't connect

There is no valid reason for this, the old iHealth app that worked with my old scale didn't require a login.

I also do not see the device appear in my Bluetooth settings, so it seems to be broken.

I will be returning the scale and posting this information elsewhere.

title: Disappointed
text: I can't wait until my iHealth device fails so I can get someone else's version. These devices are real simple and the apps should be real simple. If it is more of a pain to automatically work with the app compared to just entering into HealthKit, then why spend the extra money for a device?

title: IHealth

title: Violates your privacy

Probably all their devices work like that, I don't know. But now that I see how the scale works, it's the last time I'm buying from them.

title: BP monitor gives bogus readings
text:
Purchased the iHealth blood pressure monitor at Apple Store on 13 Nov 2913. Installed this app. Readings were always high. Got "stroke level" readings today. Called doctor; said to get to emergency room right away. Readings made there using professional equipment were normal. Will be returning the iHealth monitor to Apple Store for a full refund. 

I can NOT recommend this device.

I can no longer access any readings from my wireless scale nor my wireless blood pressure cuff.  This is a very disappointing and bugged iHealth update--do NOT "upgrade" to 3.3.6.

title: Wow, I was so wrong, disappointed (at first) but now...
text:
This is a follow up review - After using the iHealth device for the past 3+ weeks and comparing alongside 2 other similar devices at the same time, the iHealth is the only one that we are still using, the other 2 didn't make it past the first 2 weeks. 
 Hands down this one is the best of the 3 units we evaluated and the amount of data it has collected (using the iHealth wifi scale and blood pressure monitor) is impressive. The scale is definitely worth an extra $99 because it measures not only weight, but BMI, BF% (Body Fat percentage), Lean Mass lbs, Muscle Mass lbs, Bone Mass, Body Water % and most importantly can calculate VFR (Visceral Fat Rating) which is calculated and as important as your BMI and is valuable from a medical standpoint when you are monitoring weight changes, lipid profiles, and trying to decrease your risk for coronary heart disease. Visceral fat, (gut fat), is the worst kind of fat and if your BMI is high due to high visceral fat, (VFR > 12), you are in a higher risk category for coronary artery disease (CAD) than someone with same BMI and and a VFR of 7. So monitoring you VFR as well as BMI and Body fat % is as (or more) important and lowering your VFR rating directly correlates with lower associated risk of CAD. 
 Overall, the device is a valuable tool which empowers patients and gives them the ability to monitor their own health and wellness and make necessary changes on a daily basis and will also allow for better communication with their physicians and provide them with objective data and instead of treating you when you get sick, focussing on wellness will have much better outcomes.
 My biggest problem and why I am giving it 4 stars instead of 5 was the difficulty I had setting it up and lack of in-app support or on website but once I figured it out, the next one was a breeze.
(First review)
I consider myself to be somewhat tech savvy and after spending an hour trying to set it up and synced, I was unable to get it to recognize the device. I went to the website for instruction on a manual setup and found no help there. The reason I bought this device was to evaluate it and its accuracy for use with my patients in my sleep medicine practice. It seems like a very good alternative and cost effective way to monitor and evaluate patients sleep perception vs. sending them home with an actigraphy watch, which typically cost several thousand dollars for a single watch and health insurance rarely pays for it, (plus they would own it forever). But considering I can't set the device up myself and no way to communicate with customer service or support within the app, I can't recommend this particular product to my patients, many who can barely figure out how to send a text message on their smartphone. I can not understand why the device won't connect via Bluetooth to my IPad or even show up as a discoverable device.

title: Great Product, Strange Reviews...
text:
I have the wrist BP monitor which I got because my BP needs to be regularly checked due to a medication I take potentially causing a hypertensive crisis. The cuff works great and is far less a chore than the machine that they use at my Doctor's office. The next time I go in I am going to have the staff check to make sure the cuff is accurate. The first few readings I did seemed in the right range. 

The software. It works and it looks fine to me. I read some comments that it is clunky and uses odd input methods. I am really wondering what kind of people are buying this (grey hairs????) but the software is pretty standard iOS stuff. Uses some spinners to enter parameters for example, but that is run-of-the-mill iOS style apps. Thankfully iHealth did not use any "shake" selections (at least that I've seen) because some of these users would smack themselves in the face...

Integration between the software and cuff is pretty fool proof. It can tell if you have the cuff on the left or right hand (needs to be left hand). And it tells you at what angle your arm is resting (needs to be relatively horizontal). No crashes or operational problems so far. 

I work with computers and it seems to me like some of the user's submitting reviews so far don't really understand how the technology works together. Or how their iOS devices work -- for example, pairing BlueTooth devices and whatnot.

I am pleased with everything so far! Good purchase for me because I can carry the cuff around with me everywhere. Four stars, because there are perhaps more features that can be added and it looks like they are working on expanding the environment with updates.

title: HS5 Scale support still broken…
text:
From iHealth on June 25th: “we received your ticket about your HS5 Scale not connecting to your iPhones.  We have forwarded this issue to our Engineering team and they are looking on how to resolve the issue.  Preliminary findings indicate that the update to the latest iOS version 14.6 is the problem.  This is the issue so we are looking at and how to adapt our app to that latest version.”

iOS 14.6 came out May 26, 2021. As of July 27th, Two months later, I still can’t connect to my HS5 scale with any device iPhone or iPad that has the latest Apple iOS including the current iOS 14.71. I’m lucky enough to have an old iPad with iOS 12 on it. I can download my HS5 scale data with it which then syncs back to my iPhone X through the iHealth cloud. 

iHeath has consistently lagged on software development and updates. Their other new app still doesn’t support most of their previous devices. This older app is rarely updated and is terribly dated. This especially frustrating since their physical devices tend to be excellent. I have had a whole range of their devices, BP, O2, Scales and even their activity tracker in the past. I still keep hoping for a BT thermometer. I have to say, generally, I love their devices and hate their software. With a better app iHealth could be soaring but instead is hobbled by a poor and getting worse app. Hopefully this will change, but don’t hold your breath.

title: When the App works, GREAT but .?
text:
Following 5-bypasses June 2019, I got serious about my health, buying the suite of iHealth products (scale, BP, Blood Ox, Thermometer, Blood Sugar). It cost me around $300-400, but after a $250k surgery it was an important expense.

Took a while to dial in all the products - They aren't all perfect but when they work it is an "elegant" system.

The iHealth app worked well for about 6-8 months on my iPhone 8 always with latest IOS.

BUT THEN, the app mostly quit working. That is, it would try to open but would not.

 I would have to delete the app, redownload and reinstall. It would work about a week before I had to do it all over again.

It is getting worse. I need to Uninstall and reinstall every 12-48 hours now. I've been doing that since February 2020.

If this had started immediately I probably would have purchased a different system.

 Now my investment makes me hang in there HOPING  iHealth will fix this problem.

Until then I'd stay away if you hope to use their products with the iHealth app.

title: Questionable ranges for BP's and temps
text: I am generally pleased with the iHealth products and app. They seem fairly accurate. I do, however, have some concerns about what they consider a "good" blood pressure and what isn't. I have hypertension - my goal pressure is generally anything below 130/85. If I have a diastolic bp in the 80's, the app reads that as a concerning range, yet raises no alarm when my BP reads 67/45. I am a medical professional. 67/45 is not "good" anywhere I know; it's actually quite "very not good". No alarm either for bradycardia. I was very ill and had a pulse of 38; The app gave that a green light, too. The same can be said for the temperature ranges. 99.9 is green "good", but 100.0 is red "bad". No yellow range? What about adjusting for personal baselines? Mine is about 97.5. When I'm at 99.5, I have a fever. (2 degrees above baseline is a fever.) Why not save red "bad" for higher fevers and give a yellow "caution" range for low grade temps of 99.0 - 100.4 perhaps? When I scroll through my numbers for my doctor, it would certainly be helpful to have the correct ranges indicated so as to find them easier.

title: So-so App
text: This review is mostly directed towards the Blood Presses monitor but I can’t tell were which one is at fault. I own the O2 and Blood Pressure monitors. Has far as I can, the O2 monitor works fine and the app reflects that. The blood pressure monitor is another story. I was suspected the blood pressure monitor from the 1st time I used it. I changed my diet 6 months ago. Im a vegan for breakfast and lunch. For dinner, I eat a healthy meal. I’ve only gotten 2 sets of normal readings the entire time I’ve use the monitor. All other reading are stage 1 high and stage 2 high blood pressure readings. I knew that couldn’t be right, I would’ve had a heart attack by now. So today I go to the Naval Clinic and they take my blood pressure. Surprise it’s 77/125. That morning, before the appointment, my monitor showed 100/145. I think they need to work on this product a bit more. Someone who might be too trusting of these products could come to the conclusion that they’re dying young.

title: I can’t use triple check
text:
I sleep between 5am and 10am. My usual wake up time is 11-11:30 am. I work until 4 am 4 nights a week. The app won’t let me use triple check at all. It gives me an error message stating I’ve already done it for the day when I have never been able to use that feature. Also, why is the “start” button inside a side menu? That is the most ridiculous place for the MAIN button in an app. This app is specifically for the iHealth monitor. But the button is hidden? That makes no sense. I would probably take my blood pressure more if the app worked like expected. Try doing a UX study. I guarantee you’ll need to change a LOT! 

Also your BMI is wrong. My BMI when accounting for body frame is 33, your app has me at 36. Also, Jsyk, BMI is a piss poor way of measuring obesity. You should probably remove it from the app. The more important measurement is hip to waist ratio with wrist circumference accounted for. Simply because belly fat is a bigger indicator of health issues than actually being obese by BMI standards. Dwayne Johnson is obese according to BMI. Seriously think about that.
